definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: You must not have had an invasion within seven in-game days.
sentences.chinese: 你一定击碎了至少一个暗影之秋。

sentences.english: For he breaks open gates of bronze and batters down bars of iron.
sentences.chinese: 因为他把铜门摧毁，又把铁闩击碎。

sentences.english: Though his may shatter your dreams as the north wind lays waste the garden.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他的声音会击碎你的梦，像狂风尽扫园中的花。

sentences.english: Cultists cummoning in gigantic, fat demon who's shock waves shatter stone pillars in the environment.
sentences.chinese: 邪恶教徒巨大化后可以用冲击波击碎环境中石柱。

sentences.english: In Japan, they appear to have been ruptured by explosions of escaping hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，这种安全壳被逃逸的氢气产生的爆炸击碎。

sentences.english: I wanna make a day dream, but reality always knocks down the dream.
sentences.chinese: 我想做一个白日梦，可现实总是把梦击碎。

sentences.english: Though his  voice may shatter your dreams as the north wind lays waste the garden.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他的声音会击碎你的梦，像狂风尽扫园中的花。

sentences.english: Small as/though the atom is, we can smash it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管原子很小，我们可以击碎它。

sentences.english: This is either Nott or the Death Eater Luna Reducto-ed Pluto at.
sentences.chinese: 他是诺特或当面被卢娜击碎冥王星的食死徒。

sentences.english: At that moment, my whole world collapsed, lightning through my heart.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻，我整个世界都塌陷了，闪电击碎了我的心。

sentences.english: The use of Wuchang ahead of the next clip break carriage, Zhang Yucheng was rescued.
sentences.chinese: 那五常利用提前下的夹子击碎马车，张玉成被救。

sentences.english: The general broke off a huge piece, loaded it onto his horse-cart and rushed back home.
sentences.chinese: 将军把一块大冰击碎，放到他的马车上，冲回了家。

sentences.english: They can crack a ship like a nut.
sentences.chinese: 岩石击碎一条船将易如敲碎一只坚果。

sentences.english: Black and white heart of the softest place you smashed.
sentences.chinese: 黑白色的心底最柔软的地方也被你击碎了。

sentences.english: In case of emergency, break the glass and press the button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到告急环境时，击碎玻璃罩并摁下按钮。

definition: to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to penetrate/to pierce/to see clearly/to have an insight into
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
